the chief of an army.
a senior officer.
the wife of the chief of an army.
a boy or young man.
a flat, wide, plate made intertwining thin bamboo splits.
a water-vessel.
a basket in which Goddess Ellamma , a form of the mother-energy of the universe, is taken in procession.
= ಹಡ್ಡಲಗೆ.
to break up, turn over or remove earth, sand, etc., as with a shovel, spade, etc. to excavate.
the downfall, decay or destruction of anything.
young; adolescent.
a person in the time of life between puberty and maturity; youth.
a young animal.
to putforth fruit or fruits.
(a fruit) to become ripe.
(a leaf) to wither (as from old age).
(fig.) to become more (as by growing).
(voice) to become melodious.
to become bright, shiny or lustrous.
a ripe fruit.
the state of being old (as a human being from age).
the act or fact of achieving; achievement; success; accomplishment.
any substance or article used as money, as bank notes, checks, etc.; money.
a usu. round piece of metal with a distinctive stamp, and of a fixed value and weight, issued by a government as money; a coin.
the money in circulation in any country.
the money resources, income, etc. of a nation organisation or person; finance.

to become deadened, insensible caused by obstruction in blood circulation.

a wealthy man.

the tree Casearia gravolens of Symadaceae family.
a mark put on the forehead of a married woman as a symbol of her husband being alive.
